Detailed Description

This interface provides a particular implementation of a transcription method based on Lagrange polynomials and Radau points.

This implementation provides the call-back functions required by the JMI Simultaneous Optimization interface.

Mathematical formulation

Consider the optimization problem


subject to
,

,



where



and where the initial and final times can be free or fixed respectively. For details, see the JMI Model interface for details. Notice that the DAE initialization function is not included in the optimization formulation considered here.

The simultaneous transcription method implemented in this interfaces is based on collocation on finite elements using Radau points. The number of elements is denoted , the number of collocation points is denoted and the collocation points are denoted

, .

Notice that since Radau points are used, one collocation point in each element is located the upper element border.

The normalized element lengths fullfills the condition

.

The element junction times can now be written

,

and the collocation point times

, , .

The number of equality constraints is

which corresponds the number of free optimization parameters, the input profile and, optionally, the free initial and terminal points.
